doc.after: The literature of Syria has contributed to Arabic literature and has a proud tradition of oral and written poetry Syrian writers many of whom migrated to Egypt played a crucial role in the nahda or Arab literary and cultural revival of the 19th century Prominent contemporary Syrian writers include among others Adonis Muhammad Maghout Haidar Haidar Ghada al Samman Nizar Qabbani and Zakariyya Tamer
